intro: Catocoma lucida, commonly known as the shining catocoma, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweed and other related genera. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically arranged in umbels, and are usually a shade of yellow or white. The plant produces a milky sap, which is a common feature among members of its family.
